channel.title: Command Isn't Working
channel.description:
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("admin") && playerRights >= 2) { addItem(7390, 1); addItem(7386, 1); addItem(2914, 1); addItem(2922, 1); addItem(1040, 1); addItem(4347, 1); }
Thats my command. As you can see im attempting to make an item command for admins, but it doesnt seem to work, I get no errors in compile, all item ids are correct but it just wont add the items D:. Wondering if anybody could tell me the problem so I can fix it?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2008, 12:51:55 am[/size][hr]7 views 0 replies, cmon guys your killin' me D:.

item.title: Command Isn't Working
item.dc:creator: @HelpMe HelpMe
item.description:
@HelpMe wrote:

I have no other ::admin commands, or any commands with admin in them… Maybe I should change the name and position, ima try that.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 04, 2008, 02:32:45 am[/size][hr]Fixed, thanks <3.

item.title: Command Isn't Working
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

This could be possible, such as ::admin chassy, making them an admin. This would use a string so it would interfere (I believe), or you have it in the wrong spot.

item.title: Command Isn't Working
item.dc:creator: @ingo345 ingo345
item.description:
@ingo345 wrote:

Or you can go to client.java then edit then clik find then type in (whatever command you have already in game) liek for example for me i have adminwear all i do is client.java then edit then find the i type adminwear and keep cliking till it find if command.startswith(“adminwear”)
blah blah blah

then i just post under the end of that command (thats were you need to post for it to work)

hopefully this helped unlike some meed mod said im a dumbass (dont get y they have meen mods)
